document.masterDocTitle: Revision of Pygoda Amyot & Serville, 1843 stat. rest. (Heteroptera: Pentatomidae: Edessinae) with description of four new species

PANAMA
. Bocas del Toro
: ♀ Miramar , 14-
VIII-1979, 9
° N; 82°15’ W , Henk Wolda (DOE)
; ♀ Linc, 800 m , Coll. Fassl. (CAS).

Measurements. Total length 18.8–20.6; total width 10–11.3; head length 1.8–2.1; head width 3.2–3.5; length of antennal articles I: 0.7–1.1; II: 1.9–2.3; III: 1.2–1.6; IV: 3.4–4.0; V: 4.0–4.3; pronotum length 3.5–4.2; pronotum width 10.8–11.8; scutellum length 8.3–9.6; scutellum width 6.5–7.1.

Diagnosis. Species large ( 18–21mm ) and dorsally green. Pronotum and scutellum with punctures dark brown or black not on dark spots, punctuation sparser than punctuation of
P. polyta
and
P. irrorata
. Corium with all veins yellow and also yellow stains. Connexivum completely green without spots or callous ( Fig. 13A ); segment VII with base green and distal ½ to ¾ black. Body ventrally mostly greenish yellow or pale yellow with some parts light green, dark brown narrow lines on the edges of the sternites and pseudosutures. Evaporatorium with a black spot. Lateral margin of the abdomen with a green stripe corresponding to ventral part of connexivum. Antennae and legs yellow.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 7.
Pygoda expolita
. A–C Male, pygophore; A—dorsal view; B—posterior view; C—ventral view. D—Female, genital plates (Scale = 1mm).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Comments. The type of
Edessa expolita
was not indicated by Distant (1892) among the seven syntypes in the collection of The Natural History Museum ( BMNH ). One of the females has a red label, but it’s not clear if Distant labeled the specimen or not. Actually, the syntypes include females and males, so the labeled female was indicated as Lectotype . Distant described the dorsal main color as olivaceous, also part of the ventral color. The specimens studied here are light green beneath, so the color probably vanished. The pygophore ( Fig. 7C ) has the same conservation problem found in
P. ramosa
, spots similar to punctures.

Distribution ( Fig. 15 ). COSTA RICA : Alajuela , Heredia , Cartago , Puntarenas .
PANAMA
: Bocas del Toro .
